paper_abstract: A geometry analysis of Cl-pi interactions in protein-ligand complex crystal structures, showed two distinct geometries: "edge-on" approach of a Cl atom to a ring atom or C-C bond and "face-on" approach towards the ring centroid, with an average interatomic distance of 3.6 angstrom. The interaction energies were estimated as a sum of the CCSD(T) correlation contribution and the Hartree-Fock energy at the complete basis set limit, for the geometries of the benzene-chlorohydrocarbon model structures at the energy minimum obtained by potential energy surface scans using RMP2(FC)/cc-pVTZ. The calculated Cl-pi interaction energy was -2.01 kcal/mol, and the dispersion force was found to be the major source of attraction. We also discuss the geometry flexibility in Cl-pi interactions.
